intro: Kissenia mentzeloides, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in wetlands, swamps, and other moist environments, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 3 feet. Kissenia mentzeloides plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and enhancing the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
